ygData.subject: RE: [archive-crawler] Recovering a Job

Thanks for the insight, I was using 1.4.0 which didn't include
checkpointin=
g.  

Is it possible to configure the job to automatically save checkpoints=
 for
every say 10 minutes or 500 pages?  I didn't see this option available=
, so I
assume I would have to call this programmatically in a specialized
p=
rocessor.  Now in order to save checkpoint in the UI you must pause the
job=
.  Can you do this in a processor while the job is running?

Regards,
Alex
=

> From: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com

> 
> Alex wrote:
> 
> > Hi,
> >
>=
 > I am looking at the recover job feature.  Correct me if I am wrong, 
> >=
 but is it only able to reload the urls that it visited and the ones 
> > t=
hat are on the queue, and doesn't load up the information 
> originally 
> =
> associated with the CrawlURI object or CandidateURI object?
> 
> Thats ab=
out right.  It reconstitutes CrawlURI instances using a line 
> from the re=
cover log (Checkout the content of recover log).
> 
> Perhaps the 1.6 check=
pointing feature would be of use.  See 
> http://crawler.archive.org/articl=
es/user_manual.html#checkpoint.  As 
> long as what you add to CrawlURI is =
serializable it should persist 
> across a checkpoint recovery.
> 
> >
> > =
I need to store information in a CandidateURI, so when it becomes a
> > Cra=
wlURI
> > I can do something with it depending on an associatated 
> value =
using the
> > putObject/getObject methods, that has been passed through the=
 
> > Frontier.  As
> > long as the Frontier thinks it isn't a URL that we =
have 
> already visited.
> >
> Should work.  When a CandidateURI is promote=
d to CrawlURI, 
> the content 
> of the list filled with putObject is migra=
ted. Let us know if 
> it doesn't 
> work for you.
> St.Ack
> 
> > Regards,=

> > Alex
> >
